title: Bench-scale bioleach hits 72% REE recovery
excerpt: Our L9 Taguchi run demonstrates ≥72% recovery at pH 2.6 with reduced acid usage. Next: Nd–Pr–Dy separation.
content_html: We completed an L9 Taguchi design exploring pulp density, pH, and time windows. The best run achieved 72% REE recovery at pH 2.6 with reduced acid consumption. Upcoming work focuses on selective recovery (oxalate → calcination) and Nd–Pr–Dy polishing via SX/IX.

title: MoU signed with utility partner for pilot ash site
excerpt: We signed an MoU to validate bioprocess + carbonation at an active ash pond; pilot KPI dashboard will be public.
content_html: We executed an MoU with a utility to run a site-integrated pilot combining bioleaching and mineral carbonation. The pilot will share anonymized KPIs: %REE recovery, kg acid/kg REE, water recycle, and CO₂ locked.

title: Talk at MGWI Lab, IIT Bombay
excerpt: Shared our waste-to-wealth roadmap and CO₂-locking strategy; thanks to the MGWI community for feedback.
content_html: At IIT Bombay's MGWI Lab, we presented the W2W EnerGene roadmap, covering materials activation, bioleach windows, and selective recovery flowsheets. We appreciate the feedback and potential student collaborations.
